revision.text:
{{Use mdy dates|date=April 2018}} {{Infobox person | image = Kumail Nanjiani by Gage Skidmore.jpg | name = Kumail Nanjiani | caption = Nanjiani speaking at the 2012 [[WonderCon]] | birth_date = {{Birth date and age|1978|2|21}} | birth_place = [[Karachi]], [[Sindh]], [[Pakistan]] | occupation = Actor, stand-up comedian, podcast host, writer | alma mater = [[Grinnell College]], [[Karachi Grammar School]] | years_active = 2008–present | spouse = {{marriage|[[Emily V. Gordon]]|2007}} | relatives = [[Shereen Nanjiani]] (second cousin) }} '''Kumail Nanjiani''' (born February 21, 1978){{cite web|url=https://twitter.com/TVsJonDore/status/39885028154548224|title=Twitter / TVsJonDore: Happy Birthday Kumail Nanjiani!! |publisher=Twitter.com|date=February 21, 2011|accessdate=April 22, 2014}} is a [[Pakistani-American]] stand-up comedian, actor, writer, and podcast host. Nanjiani is best known for being a main cast member on [[HBO|HBO's]] [[Emmy Award|Emmy Award-nominated]] series ''[[Silicon Valley (TV series)|Silicon Valley]]'', as well as for providing the voice of [[List of Adventure Time characters#Prismo|Prismo]] on the Emmy Award-winning animated series ''[[Adventure Time]]''. He starred on the [[TNT (U.S. TV network)|TNT]] series ''[[Franklin & Bash]]'' and the [[Adult Swim]] series ''[[Newsreaders]]''. Nanjiani also co-hosted the [[Comedy Central]] show ''[[The Meltdown with Jonah and Kumail]]''. In addition to his television and film work, he hosted two podcasts: ''The Indoor Kids'' and ''The X-Files Files''. In 2017, Nanjiani starred in the semi-autobiographical [[romantic comedy]] film ''[[The Big Sick]]'', which he wrote with his wife [[Emily V. Gordon]]. They were nominated for the [[Academy Award for Best Original Screenplay]] at the [[90th Academy Awards]]. ==Early life== Nanjiani was born in [[Karachi]], [[Pakistan]], the son of Shabana and Aijaz Nanjiani.{{cite web|url=https://www.newyorker.com/magazine/2017/05/08/kumail-nanjianis-culture-clash-comedy|title=Kumail Nanjiani's Culture-Clash Comedy|first=Andrew|last=Marantz|date=May 1, 2017|publisher=|via=www.newyorker.com}} He was raised as a [[Shia Islam|Shia Muslim]], but has left the faith.{{cite web|url=https://www.slantmagazine.com/features/article/interview-kumail-nanjiani-on-the-big-sick-marriage-comedy-and-silicon-valley|title=Interview: Kumail Nanjiani on The Big Sick's Real-Life Love Story|date=June 22, 2017}} The Scottish radio presenter [[Shereen Nanjiani]] is his second cousin.{{cite web |first=Shereen |last=Nanjiani |authorlink=Shereen Nanjiani |publisher=[[BBC Radio Scotland]] |work=Shereen |title=Extended Interview with Kumail Nanjiani |url=http://www.bbc.co.uk/programmes/p00y0g8q |date=September 1, 2012 |accessdate=February 13, 2013}}{{cite web |first=Kevin |last=Allison |authorlink=Kevin Allison |work=[[Risk!]] |url=http://risk-show.com/podcast/live-from-san-francisco/ |title=Live From San Francisco! |date=February 11, 2013 |accessdate=February 13, 2013}}{{cite web|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=T_EOB2KE_ys&feature=youtu.be&t=80|title=Interview: Kumail Nanjiani Explains Pakistani Culture (Full Interview)|date=Jun 28, 2017}} During his childhood, Nanjiani lived in Karachi and attended [[Karachi Grammar School]]. At 18, he moved to the United States and attended [[Grinnell College]] in [[Iowa]], from which he graduated in 2001. He completed a double major in computer science and [[philosophy]]. ==Career== ===2008–2016: Television work=== In July 2011, he and ''[[X-Play]]'' staffer Ali Baker began hosting a [[video game]]-themed [[podcast]], titled ''[[Nerdist Industries#Nerdist Podcast Network|The Indoor Kids]]''. In late August of the same year Baker left the show and Nanjiani began hosting with his wife, [[Emily V. Gordon]]. Until other commitments took over, he appeared regularly on [[Dan Harmon]]'s podcast ''[[Harmontown]]'', where he played ''[[Dungeons & Dragons]]'' with Harmon as a character named [[Chris de Burgh]]. He played a delivery man in the 2013 film, ''[[The Kings of Summer]]''.{{cite web|url=http://collider.com/kings-of-summer-red-band-trailer/ |title=The Kings of Summer Red-Band Trailer |publisher=Collider.com |date=May 20, 2013 |accessdate=June 29, 2014}} In addition to guest-starring in various comedy shows like ''[[Portlandia (TV series)|Portlandia]]'', Nanjiani was featured in a supporting role in the [[TNT (U.S. TV network)|TNT]] series ''[[Franklin & Bash]]''. He played the role of Pindar Singh, an agoraphobic science fiction nerd working for the title characters. Nanjiani guest-starred on HBO's ''[[Veep (TV series)|Veep]]'' as a statistician. He had a recurring role of Amir Larussa on ''[[Newsreaders]]'', as well as Prismo on ''[[Adventure Time]]''. His [[Comedy Central]] special titled ''Beta Male'' aired in July 2013. In late June 2013, Comedy Central announced the pickup of a show ''[[The Meltdown with Jonah and Kumail]]'' hosted by [[Jonah Ray]] and Nanjiani. The show, featuring Nerd Melt comedy regulars and various comedians, began airing in July 2014. In April 2014, he began playing the character Dinesh in the [[HBO]] sitcom ''[[Silicon Valley (TV series)|Silicon Valley]]''. He voiced Reggie in the video game ''[[The Walking Dead: Season Two]]''. In July 2014, Nanjiani hosted a weekly podcast titled ''The X-Files Files'', dedicated to discussion and fond reminiscences about ''[[The X-Files]]''. Each episode features him and a guest, including former ''The X-Files'' writers, producers, actors and directors, in light-hearted banter about one or two episodes of the series. On July 30, 2014, Nanjiani appeared on [[Ken Reid (comedian)|Ken Reid]]'s ''TV Guidance Counselor Podcast''.{{citation needed|date=May 2015}} In 2015, Nanjiani guest-starred in an episode of ''[[Broad City]]'' called "In Heat".{{cite news|last1=Cruz|first1=Lenika|title=Bed, Bath, and Bong Rips: The Glorious Return of Broad City|url=https://www.theatlantic.com/entertainment/archive/2015/01/the-glorious-return-of-broad-city/384405/|accessdate=May 10, 2015|work=[[The Atlantic]]|date=January 14, 2015}} Starting on March 22, 2015 he provided his voice for the character of Mshak Moradi in the ''[[Hunt the Truth]]'' audio drama, part of the marketing campaign for ''[[Halo 5: Guardians]]''.{{cite web|title=Halo 5: Guardians #HuntTheTruth – Has the Master Chief Gone AWOL?|author=Xbox Wire Staff|date=May 17, 2015|website=News.xbox.com|url=http://news.xbox.com/2015/05/games-hunt-the-truth-podcast-episode-8}} On May 5, 2015, he appeared on ''[[Inside Amy Schumer]]'' in the episode "12 Angry Men Inside Amy Schumer", a parody of ''[[Twelve Angry Men|12 Angry Men]]'', as one of the members of the jury.{{cite news|last1=Holmes|first1=Linda|title=Amy Schumer Puts Her Own Looks On Trial|url=https://www.npr.org/blogs/monkeysee/2015/05/06/404649955/amy-schumer-puts-her-own-looks-on-trial|accessdate=May 10, 2015|work=NPR.org|date=May 6, 2015}} In July 2015, Nanjiani provided guest voices on ''[[Aqua Teen Hunger Force]]'' and ''[[Penn Zero: Part-Time Hero]]''.{{cite web|title=New Listings for Disney XD – July 2015|url=http://thedisneydrivenlife.com/2015/06/30/new-listings-for-disney-xd-july-2015/|publisher=The Disney Driven Life|accessdate=July 1, 2015|date=June 30, 2015}} In November 2015, he starred in an [[Old Navy]] TV commercial together with [[Julia Louis-Dreyfus]] and [[Snoop Dogg]].{{cite web|author=Liviu Marica|url=http://dailycommercials.com/old-navy-snoopin-around-featurig-snoop-dogg/ |title= Old Navy: Snoopin' Around featurig Snoop Dogg |publisher=Daily Commercials|date= |accessdate=November 23, 2015}} In April 2016, he starred in another Old Navy advertisement with [[Saturday Night Live|''SNL'']] cast members [[Jay Pharoah]], [[Cecily Strong]], and [[Nasim Pedrad]]. ===2017–present: Breakthrough in film=== In 2017, Nanjiani starred in the [[romantic comedy]] film ''[[The Big Sick]]'', which he wrote with his wife Emily V. Gordon.{{cite web|url=http://www.indiewire.com/2017/01/amazon-the-big-sick-bidding-war-sundance-film-acquisition-1201771744/|title=Amazon Wins 'The Big Sick' Bidding War $12 Million Buy Sundance 2017|last1=Winfrey|first1=Graham|date=January 22, 2017|work=[[IndieWire]]|accessdate=April 11, 2017}} The film is about their relationship, with Nanjiani playing himself and [[Zoe Kazan]] playing Gordon (renamed Emily Gardner). The film was considered to be one of the most acclaimed films of 2017, and was chosen by [[American Film Institute]] as one of the top 10 films of the year and was nominated for the [[Academy Award for Best Original Screenplay]].{{Cite web|url=http://www.afi.com/afiawards/AFI-Awards-2017.aspx|title=AFI Awards 2017|website=[[American Film Institute|AFI]]|accessdate=December 8, 2017}}{{cite web|url=https://www.hollywoodreporter.com/lists/oscar-nominations-2018-complete-list-nominees-1067893 |title=Oscars: 'Shape of Water' Leads With 13 Noms |work=[[The Hollywood Reporter]] |date=January 23, 2018|accessdate=January 23, 2018}} The film was also the third highest grossing [[independent film]] released in 2017, grossing over 40 million dollars.{{cite web|url=http://www.indiewire.com/2017/06/highest-grossing-indie-films-2017-1201764229/|title=The 20 Highest Grossing Indies of 2017 (A Running List) – IndieWire|first=Kate|last=Erbland|work=[[IndieWire]]|accessdate=September 7, 2017}} In 2019, Nanjiani will lend his voice to Plimpton, an ostrich, in ''[[The Voyage of Doctor Dolittle (film)|The Voyage of Doctor Dolittle]]''.{{Cite news|url=https://www.hollywoodreporter.com/heat-vision/voyage-doctor-dolittle-cast-robert-downey-jr-unveils-full-list-1097797|title=Robert Downey Jr. Unveils Voice Cast for 'Voyage of Doctor Dolittle'|work=The Hollywood Reporter|access-date=2018-03-27|language=en}} The film is set for release on April 12, 2019.{{cite news|last1=Kit|first1=Borys|title=Robert Downey Jr.'s 'Doctor Dolittle' Moves Release to Avoid 'Star Wars'|url=http://www.hollywoodreporter.com/news/dr-dolittle-movie-starring-robert-downey-jr-gets-a-new-release-date-998624|accessdate=April 29, 2017|work=The Hollywood Reporter|date=April 28, 2017|language=en}} Nanjiani will also star in the [[action-comedy]] ''[[Stuber (film)|Stuber]]'', which is set for release on May 24, 2019.{{cite web|url=https://www.hollywoodreporter.com/heat-vision/kumail-nanjiani-star-opposite-dave-bautista-action-comedy-stuber-1095889|title=Kumail Nanjiani to Star Opposite Dave Bautista in Action Comedy 'Stuber' (Exclusive)|publisher=}}[https://deadline.com/2018/06/20th-century-fox-sets-dates-for-untitled-james-mangold-ferrari-project-kenneth-branaghs-death-on-the-nile-1202416198/ 20th Century Fox Sets Dates For Untitled James Mangold Ferrari Project, Kenneth Branagh’s ‘Death On The Nile’] Nanjiani will also costar in the ''Untitled "Men in Black" Spin-Off film'', which will be released on June 14, 2019.[https://www.hollywoodreporter.com/heat-vision/men-black-movie-spinoff-adds-cast-1124261 'Men in Black' Movie Spinoff Adds 'Jurassic' Actor to Cast (Exclusive)]{{cite news|last1=Busch|first1=Anita|title=‘Men In Black’ Spinoff Gets Summer 2019 Release Date Change|url=http://deadline.com/2018/01/men-in-black-untitled-spinoff-release-date-change-summer-2019-1202248296/|accessdate=May 29, 2018|work=Deadline|date=January 18, 2018}} ==Personal life== Nanjiani has been married to [[Emily V. Gordon]], an author, comedy producer, and former couples and family therapist since 2007.{{cite web|url=http://www.cosmopolitan.com/sex-love/advice/a6877/secret-life-of-marrieds-kumail-emily/|title=The Secret Life of Marrieds: Why We Kept Our Marriage Secret for Years|last=Marie|first=Jane|date=May 20, 2014|work=[[Cosmopolitan (magazine)|Cosmopolitan]]|accessdate=May 5, 2017}} Gordon was the booker and producer of ''[[The Meltdown with Jonah and Kumail]]'' (2014–2016).{{cite web|url=http://www.newyorker.com/magazine/2017/05/08/kumail-nanjianis-culture-clash-comedy|title=Kumail Nanjiani's Culture-Clash Comedy|last=Marantz|first=Andrew|date=May 8, 2017|work=[[The New Yorker]]|accessdate=May 30, 2017}} ==Filmography== ===Film=== {| class="wikitable sortable" |- ! Year ! Title ! Area Film Critics Association]] | [[Washington D.C. Area Film Critics Association Award for Best Original Screenplay|Best Original Screenplay]] | {{nom}} |- | [[Independent Spirit Awards]] | [[Independent Spirit Award for Best First Screenplay|Best First Screenplay]] | {{won}} |- | [[NAACP Image Awards]] | [[49th NAACP Image Awards|Outstanding Writing in a Motion Picture]] | {{nom}} |- |[[Screen Actors Guild Award]] |[[Screen Actors Guild Award for Outstanding Performance by a Cast in a Motion Picture|Outstanding Performance by a Cast in a Motion Picture]] |{{nom}} |- | [[Critics' Choice Television Award]]s | [[Critics' Choice Television Award for Best Supporting Actor in a Comedy Series|Best Supporting Actor in a Comedy Series]] | ''[[Silicon Valley (TV series)|Silicon Valley]]'' | {{nom}} |} ==References== {{reflist|refs= {{cite news |first=Eric |last=Konigsberg |newspaper=[[The New York Times]] |title=It's Not a Bad Time to Be Funny in the City |url=https://www.nytimes.com/2009/11/01/arts/television/01koni.html?pagewanted=all&_r=0 |date=October 30, 2009 |accessdate=March 4, 2014}} {{cite web |publisher=[[Grinnell College]] |title=Interview with Comedian Kumail Nanjiani '01 |url=http://www.grinnell.edu/news/interview-comedian-kumail-nanjiani-%E2%80%9901 |date=September 22, 2010 |accessdate=April 22, 2014}} {{cite web |first1=Ali |last1=Baker |first2=Kumail |last2=Nanjiani |url=http://www.nerdist.com/2011/07/the-indoor-kids-1-steve-agee/ |accessdate= January 31, 2016|title=#1 Steve Agee |work=The Indoor Kids |publisher=[[Nerdist Industries]] |date=July 15, 2012}} {{cite news |first=Amanda |last=Kondolojy |work=[[TV by the Numbers]] |title=Comedy Central Greenlights 'The Meltdown With Jonah and Kumail' |url=http://tvbythenumbers.zap2it.com/2013/06/20/comedy-central-greenlights-the-meltdown-with-jonah-and-kumail/188292/ |date=June 20, 2013 |accessdate=April 22, 2014}} {{cite web |first=David |last=Sims |publisher=[[The A.V. |accessdate=June 29, 2014}} {{cite web |title=The Meltdown with Jonah and Kumail |url=https://nerdmeltla.com/the-meltdown-with-jonah-and-kumail/ |publisher=NerdmeltLA.com |accessdate=June 29, 2014 |title=The X-Files Files |url=https://itunes.apple.com/us/podcast/kumail-nanjianis-x-files-files/id885275285?mt=2 |accessdate=July 23, 2014}} }} ==External links== {{commons category}} * {{IMDb name}}
